meanings.sent1: Her perfidy was revealed when she lied about her involvement in the crime.
meanings.sent2: The perfidy of the con artist left many people in financial ruin.
meanings.sent3: The perfidy of the sneaky fox trying to steal the hen's eggs was comical.
meanings.sent4: The perfidy of the storm clouds, hiding their true intentions, caught us off guard.
meanings.sent5: The perfidy of the mirror, showing a distorted reflection, made her question her appearance.

meanings.definition: An act of deliberate betrayal or treachery.
meanings.sent1: The king's perfidy towards his loyal subjects led to a rebellion.
meanings.sent2: The perfidy of the spy jeopardized the entire mission.
meanings.sent3: The perfidy of the mischievous kitten pretending to be innocent was amusing.
meanings.sent4: The perfidy of the sinking ship, abandoning its crew, was a heartbreaking betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The perfidy of the dark alley, hiding dangers unseen, made her cautious.
